t: 2 Corinthians 8
Excel in Giving
Moreover,*p brethren, we make known to you the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia:
that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded in the riches of their liberality.
For I bear witness that according to their*i ability, yes, and beyond their*i ability, they*i were*i freely willing,
imploring us with much urgency that we would receive the gift and the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
And not only*i as we had hoped, but they first gave themselves to the Lord, and then*i to us by the will of God.
So we urged Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete this grace in you as well.
But as you abound in everything—in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in all diligence, and in your love for us— see*i that you abound in this grace also.
Christ Our Pattern
I*p speak not by commandment, but I am testing the sincerity of your love by the diligence of others.
For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that you through His poverty might become rich.
And*p in this I give advice: It is to your advantage not only to be doing what you began and were desiring to do a year ago;
but now you also must complete the doing of*i it;*i that as there*i was*i a readiness to desire it,*i so there*i also may*i be*i a completion out of what you*i have.
For if there is first a willing mind, it*i is*i accepted according to what one has, and*i not according to what he does not have.
For*p I*i do*i not mean that others should be eased and you burdened;
but by an equality, that*i now at this time your abundance may*i supply*i their lack, that their abundance also may supply*i your lack—that there may be equality.
As it is written, “He who gathered*i much had nothing left over, and he who gathered*i little had no lack.”
Collection for the Judean Saints
But*p thanks be*i to God who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus.
For he not only accepted the exhortation, but being more diligent, he went to you of his own accord.
And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is*i in the gospel throughout all the churches,
and not only that,*i but who was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this gift, which is administered by us to the glory of the Lord Himself and to*i show*i your ready mind,
avoiding this: that anyone should blame us in this lavish gift which is administered by us—
providing honorable things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
And*p we have sent with them our brother whom we have often proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, because of the great confidence which we*i have*i in you.
If anyone*i inquires*i about Titus, he*i is*i my partner and fellow worker concerning you. Or if our brethren are*i inquired*i about,*i they*i are*i messengers of the churches, the glory of Christ.
Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf.
